body.p: Identify the respiratory structures that air passes through during inspiration.

fill_in_the_blank.choice: Nasal cavity- Location of our sense smell.
Oropharnyx-covered in stratified squamous epithelia to protect from friction wear of food entering.
Epiglottis- Normally open to allow air to freely flow into the larynx but is closed when food and water are being swallowed.
Lanygopharynx- Is the most inferior portion of the pharynx and carries air and food.
Larynx-Passageway for air and contains the vocal chords.
Nasal cavity- Location of our sense smell.
Oropharnyx-covered in stratified squamous epithelia to protect from friction wear of food entering.
Epiglottis- Normally open to allow air to freely flow into the larynx but is closed when food and water are being swallowed.
Lanygopharynx- Is the most inferior portion of the pharynx and carries air and food.
Larynx-Passageway for air and contains the vocal chords.
Nasal cavity- Location of our sense smell.
Oropharnyx-covered in stratified squamous epithelia to protect from friction wear of food entering.
Epiglottis- Normally open to allow air to freely flow into the larynx but is closed when food and water are being swallowed.
Lanygopharynx- Is the most inferior portion of the pharynx and carries air and food.
Larynx-Passageway for air and contains the vocal chords.
Nasal cavity- Location of our sense smell.
Oropharnyx-covered in stratified squamous epithelia to protect from friction wear of food entering.
Epiglottis- Normally open to allow air to freely flow into the larynx but is closed when food and water are being swallowed.
Lanygopharynx- Is the most inferior portion of the pharynx and carries air and food.
Larynx-Passageway for air and contains the vocal chords.
Nasal cavity- Location of our sense smell.
Oropharnyx-covered in stratified squamous epithelia to protect from friction wear of food entering.
Epiglottis- Normally open to allow air to freely flow into the larynx but is closed when food and water are being swallowed.
Lanygopharynx- Is the most inferior portion of the pharynx and carries air and food.
Larynx-Passageway for air and contains the vocal chords.

response.feedback: Correct. Location of our sense smell.
Incorrect. In addition to smell the functions of our nose are to warm and humidify the incoming air. The nasal cavity has to be located where it is exposed to the air.
Incorrect. In addition to smell the functions of our nose are to warm and humidify the incoming air. The nasal cavity has to be located where it is exposed to the air.
Incorrect. In addition to smell the functions of our nose are to warm and humidify the incoming air. The nasal cavity has to be located where it is exposed to the air.
Incorrect. In addition to smell the functions of our nose are to warm and humidify the incoming air. The nasal cavity has to be located where it is exposed to the air.
Incorrect. The oropharynx is the second division of the pharynx.
Correct. The oropharynx is covered in stratified squamous epithelia to protect from friction wear of food entering from the mouth.
Incorrect. The oropharynx is the second division of the pharynx. The prefix Oro- means mouth, the oropharynx is connected to the oral cavity.
Incorrect. The oropharynx is the second division of the pharynx. The prefix Oro- means mouth, the oropharynx is connected to the oral cavity.
Incorrect. The oropharynx is the second division of the pharynx. The prefix Oro- means mouth, the oropharynx is connected to the oral cavity.
Incorrect. The epiglottis functions to keep food and water out of the larynx and must be located just anterior to it.
Incorrect. The epiglottis functions to keep food and water out of the larynx and must be located just anterior to it.
Correct. The Epiglottis is normally open to allow air to freely flow into the larynx but is closed when food and water are being swallowed.
Incorrect. The epiglottis functions to keep food and water out of the larynx and must be located just anterior to it.
Incorrect. The epiglottis functions to keep food and water out of the larynx and must be located just anterior to it.
Incorrect. The Laryngopharynx is the most inferior portion of the pharynx and is located in the throat.
Incorrect. The laryngopharynx is the most inferior portion of the pharynx not the middle portion although it does carry both air and food.
Incorrect. Is the most inferior portion of the pharynx and carries air and food.
Correct. Is the most inferior portion of the pharynx and carries air and food.
Incorrect. Is the most inferior portion of the pharynx and carries air and food. It is not actually part of the larynx it is separated from it by the epiglottis.
Incorrect. Passageway for air and contains the vocal chords that is located in the chest.
Incorrect. Passageway for air and contains the vocal chords. It is inferior to the pharynx and the epiglottis.
Incorrect. Passageway for air and contains the vocal chords. It is located after all three divisions of the pharynx.
Incorrect. The Larynx is the passageway for air and contains the vocal chords. It is located inferior to the epiglottis.
Correct. Passageway for air and contains the vocal chords.
